concept.title: Metrics
concept.shortdesc: API Management Metrics services collect the metadata of API calls via the API Gateway or the Web Services Server and allows you to retrieve the data using a GraphQL client. Metrics services return information such as the count of calls per API, successful API requests, popular authentication types for APIs, and the quota status of a subscribed API.

section.title: Enable Metrics Data Collection
section.p: Metrics services are disabled by default, but can be enabled in multiple ways. To enable, do one of the following:

ul.li: Enable in Settings > Account > Features > API Metrics Access.
Enable on the API Gateway, Molecules, and Clouds in Properties > Settings & Configuration > Properties > Advanced > Capture API Metrics.

section.p: Each Gateway must be restarted after enabling or disabling API Metrics.
If you have multi-node Gateways, Molecules, or Clouds, you must add the following to enable the Working Data Local Storage Directory:com.boomi.container.localDir
For Atoms, the metrics data is written to the <installation>/events directory. For Gateways, Molecules, and Clouds, the metrics data is written to the <local dir>/events directory.

p.note: Ensure that there is sufficient disk space available. Metrics requires approximately 1 KB per request, per day. Files are rolled over each day and removed when not needed.
Metrics does not support requests to a Shared Web Server if its API Type is set to Intermediate. 404 and 401 errors are not captured on local clouds.

row.entry: The date and time the request was submitted. Uses UTC timezone ("Z").
The type of authentication configured for the API deployment.
The ID of the Atom where the API call was processed
User management functionality level available on the Atom.
The ID of the Gateway where the API call was processed.
The default API Execution Settings of the Gateway.
A list of Environment objects attached to the Gateway.
The Forward Proxy configuration of the Gateway.
The ID of the AtomSphere account where the API call was processed.
The ID of the deployed API for a specific environment.
The Authentication Source of the deployed API.
The Component information of the deployed API.
The Custom Policies configuration of the deployed API.
The Endpoint information of the deployed API.
The Environment information of the deployed API.
The Execution Settings of the deployed API.
The Keyless Plan information of the deployed API.
The Metadata of the deployed API.
The Plans associated with the deployed API.
The Required Roles information of the deployed API.
The Subscriptions of the deployed API.
The backend process ID. Detail only.
The HTTP response code of the API response.
The HTTP method contained in the request.
The HTTP path contained in the request.
The client’s IP address as reported to the server.
The value of the user-agent HTTP request header.
The authenticated user. Can be optioned out not to collect it.
The unique transaction ID for the request. Detail only.
The HTTP path contained in the backend process. Detail only.
The ID of the AtomSphere process. Detail only.
The timestamp at which the quota will reset. Detail only.
The timestamp at which the rate will reset. Detail only.
The total response time to process the request (API plus Gateway response time).
Time the backend took to process the request.
The count of requests made by the client since the start of the quota period. Detail only.
The count of requests made by the client since the start of the rate period. Detail only.
The date and time of the start of the interval. Summary only.
The date and time of the end of the interval. Summary only.
The maximum date and time of any API request in the interval. Summary only.
The minimum date and time of any API request in the interval. Summary only.
The count of API requests. Summary only.

li.p: deployedApiCallDetail: Returns API request details that match the filters in the input object. The number of records is capped and if there are more records than are returned, the nextRequestTs and nextTransactionId fields will be populated in the return object.deployedApiCallDetail(input: DeployedApiCallDetailInput!): DeployedApiCallDetail!

ul.li: deployedApiCallSummary: Returns grouped and aggregated API request info as specified by the request fields and applies the filters specified in the input object.deployedApiCallSummary(input: DeployedApiCallSummaryInput!): DeployedApiCallSummary!

section.title: Querying API Metrics Data
section.codeblock:
type DeployedApiCallDetailData { " The date and time the request was submitted. Uses UTC timezone (\"Z\")." requestTs: DateTime! " The unique request id" transactionId: ID! " The Api deployed to a specific environment and the various information associated with it" deployedApi: DeployedApi! " The Account that owns the Deployed Api" account: Account! " The Gateway details (Name, Gateway Status, Environment, Api Execution Settings and Forward proxy)" gateway: Gateway " The Atom details (Name, Auth type, Webservice type, Status etc.,)" atom: Atom " The Http response code of the Api response" status: Int! " The details of the client that made the Api request (remoteAddress, userAgent, subscription)" client: DeployedApiClient! " The User that executed the Api request" user: DeployedApiUser """ The Deployed Api's Authentication Type. (The authentication type that the account uses when communicating with the Atom, Molecule, Atom Cloud Or Gateway.) """ authType: DeployedApiCallAuthType! " The fully qualified absolute Url" requestUrl: String! " The Http method of the Api request" method: HttpMethod " The number of milliseconds from the time the request was received until the response was sent" responseDuration: Int! " The number of bytes received from request body" bytesReceived: Long! " The number of bytes sent from response" bytesSent: Long! " The count of incoming requests for the quota period" quotaCount: Long " The date and time that the quota will reset" quotaReset: DateTime " The count of incoming requests for the rate limit period" rateCount: Long " The date and time that the rate limit will reset" rateReset: DateTime " The error message that is received from backend execution" errorMessage: String "(For Api Gateway Requests) The URL of the Atom to which the request was forwarded" backendUrl: String """ (For Api Gateway Requests) The number of milliseconds from the time the Atom received the request from the Api Gateway until the Atom sent the response back to the Api Gateway """ backendDuration: Int " The id of the Integration Process that executed as a result of this Api request" process: Process " The id of the Integration Process Execution" execution: Execution }
type DeployedApiCallSummaryData { " The date and time of the start of the interval" requestTsIntervalStart: DateTime! " The date and time of the end of the interval" requestTsIntervalEnd: DateTime! " The maximum date and time of any Api request in the interval" requestTsMax: DateTime! " The minimum date and time of any Api request in the interval" requestTsMin: DateTime! " The Api deployed to a specific environment and the various information associated with it" deployedApi: DeployedApi! " The Account that owns the Deployed Api" account: Account! " The Gateway details (Name, Gateway Status, Environment, Api Execution Settings and Forward proxy)" gateway: Gateway " The Atom details (Name, Auth type, Webservice type, Status etc.,)" atom: Atom " The Http response code of the Api response" status: Int! " The details of the client that made the Api request (remoteAddress, userAgent, subscription)" client: DeployedApiClient! " The User that executed the Api request" user: DeployedApiUser """ The Deployed Api's Authentication Type. (The authentication type that the account uses when communicating with the Atom, Molecule, Atom Cloud Or Gateway.) """ authType: DeployedApiCallAuthType! " The fully qualified absolute Url" requestUrl: String! " The Http method of the Api request" method: HttpMethod """ The number of milliseconds from the time the request was received until the response was sent (summarized by Metric field - count, total, max, min, mean, standard deviation etc) """ responseDuration: Metric """ (For Api Gateway Requests) The number of milliseconds from the time the Atom received the request from the Api Gateway until the Atom sent the response back to the Api Gateway (summarized by Metric field - count, total, max, min, mean, standard deviation etc) """ backendDuration: Metric """ The number of bytes received from request body (summarized by Metric field - count, total, max, min, mean, standard deviation etc) """ bytesReceived: Metric """ The number of bytes sent from response (summarized by Metric field - count, total, max, min, mean, standard deviation etc) """ bytesSent: Metric "The count of Api requests" requestCount: Long }

section.title: Using the filter attribute
section.p:
The following fields are not filterable from the platform:
Gateway
Atom
deployedApi
To filter by API Key, use:filter: "client.subscription.apiKeyId = 'f1xxxx77-fxxc-4e19-b144-6efxxxxxxxf6e' "

section.title: Altair script
section.p: Programmatic access to GraphQL APIs is available via any application, typically through a GraphQL client library in the language of choice. Altair is a user interface tool that can be used to accomplish this. A following script was created as an option to quickly access GraphQL APIs. See Altair Script.
